FuncDef:
The least active-bandwidth command sets the lower limit for an IP-Trunk interface's bandwidth.
The undo least active-bandwidth command restores the default lower limit for an IP-Trunk interface's bandwidth.
By default, no lower limit is configured for an IP-Trunk interface's bandwidth.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a lower limit for the bandwidth of an IP-Trunk interface's member interfaces.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295, in Mbit/s.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The bandwidth of an IP-Trunk interface refers to the sum of all Up member interfaces' bandwidth. To ensure uninterrupted traffic forwarding, run the least active-bandwidth command to set the lower limit for an IP-Trunk interface's bandwidth. The IP-Trunk interface can go Up only after the sum of all Up member interfaces' bandwidth is greater than or equal to the set lower limit. Otherwise, the IP-Trunk interface goes Down.
Prerequisites
An IP-Trunk interface has been configured.
Configuration Impact
After the lower limit is set for an IP-Trunk interface's bandwidth:
The IP-Trunk interface goes Down when the sum of all Up member interfaces' bandwidth falls below the lower limit.The IP-Trunk interface goes Up when the sum of all Up member interfaces' bandwidth reaches the lower limit.

Precautions
This command is mutually exclusive with the least active-linknumber command. Check that the least active-linknumber command configuration does not exist before running this command.
To prevent an IP-Trunk interface from alternating between Up and Down, the lower limits configured on both ends of the IP-Trunk must be the same.
